revised_title: Ossification of the Crural Artery: A Case Study
tldr: This article describes a case study of a patient with an ossification of the crural artery, which led to a mortification and eventually the patient's death. The author, Edward Naish, discusses the operation and dissection of the artery, highlighting the ossification as the cause of the mortification. He also speculates that such cases might be more common than realized, attributing some extremity mortifications in elderly patients to ossification.
